google_reviews.author: Sonya Johnson
google_reviews.review: The property grounds are well maintained.  Staff is helpful and responsive.  On-site management are helpful and responsive.  I enjoy views of the green belt.  The back door accessing a patio which opens onto the green space is a real luxury.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your review, Sonya! We're thrilled to hear that you're enjoying your experience at Barkley, from our attentive staff to the beautiful views of the green belt. We agree that the patio access to the green space is indeed a bonus. Your feedback is valuable to us, and we're pleased to know we're meeting your expectations.

google_reviews.author: Shane Lizard
google_reviews.review: Ive lived here in my rotting apartment for almost 2 years now and have seen no improvement to the complex besides a brand new entryway. Ive had my vehicles broken into/ stolen at least 4 times. Homeless people taking over the dumpsters and office staff that only cares about their own image. The communication between residents is also completely controlled and censored by office staff. Be careful renting here

ownerResponse.text: We're sorry that you havent had an enjoyable stay with us at Barkley. Our team strives on a daily basis to cultivate a welcoming, comfortable living experience for our residents, and we apologize that you havent seen our efforts reflected in your stay. We hope that you'll contact us directly at 360-647-2818 to discuss your experiences further and how you feel we might improve. Thank you.

google_reviews.author: Andy Marshall
google_reviews.review: These people take advantage of young people. My son rented for a year and a half. He was charged for water damage from the apartment above. They found cockroaches after moving in and the management just shrugged it off and said they should have spotted it before moving in. Him and his roommate are being charged thousands of dollars for trumped up damage claims for pre existing wear and damage. Will be working with the Washington State Attorney Generals Office to pursue action against them for violating tenants rights.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your review. We sincerely regret that our customer service did not meet your expectations. Our staff members are all professionals dedicated to service excellence, and we strive to provide exemplary care and attention. Kindly have your son who resides with us reach out to us at 360-647-2818 to discuss any issues he feels needs additional attention from us. Thanks again.

google_reviews.author: K M
google_reviews.review:
We enjoyed living here. I really loved our apartment. Anne is an awesome manager and took immediate action if there was a maintenance problem or neighbor issues. I loved that each unit had a washer and dryer.

I miss living here and we only moved because we moved out of state. If youre looking for a nice place to live I highly recommend it. Most places do not compare. Wonderful location and awesome amenities.

I believe the pricing on these units is fair and is actually accurate due to the booming market in Bellingham. Count your blessings it could be 2.5 more in other states.

And yes, I really did live here.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your kind words. The Barkley Staff

google_reviews.author: Allison
google_reviews.review:
The only nice thing about this complex is their pool. The pool and hot tub are great. Other than that, expect to get a terribly laid out apartment with appliances that constantly need repairs that are NOT worth the price by any means. The staff is generally kind, but they are very disorganized and put us through a lot of stress because of it.

We added a roommate after moving in who, despite handing in all of the paperwork weeks before he moved in, was not added to the lease until three months later when they applied his rent check to a different apartment and almost evicted us because of it. They gave us notices for showings of other apartments, so those people never received proper notice just because the lady failed to read the apartment # correctly. They also wrote our lease incorrectly the second time we signed it to add our roommate, which ended up costing us about $1300 when we moved out. They also skimp on the deposit refund.
So I would stay away. You can easily find somewhere cheaper, much better quality and better managed.

ownerResponse.text: Hi Allison, we appreciate your feedback and want to be a helpful resource to our Residents. It looks like the ball was dropped with your paperwork and we are sorry for the stress it caused. We definitely don't want that happening again. Since then, we have a team in place with checks a balances to ensure this process. We strive to do a great job and want our Residents feel this on a daily basis. Thank you -Barkley Trails Team

google_reviews.author: Joseph Daily
google_reviews.review: They let us get through the entire application process before finally mentioning they don't allow huskies. They will take your money knowing they won't accept your application. Would not recommend applying if you have any dogs over 20 pounds or in general as they will happily lie to you to take your money.

google_reviews.author: Maghan Haynie
google_reviews.review:
This place is not worth the money they are charging for rent. There is no storage space, super small kitchen (which the burners dont work half the time), and parking is terrible. We had a 6 mo lease and had found out 2 weeks before our lease was up that we had got our new home. They said they have to charge us another months rent for somewhere we are not even going to be living. Thats a lot of money to give for something that isnt even in use.
Another issue i had is I initially thought my package got stolen or delivered to the wrong apartment. Come to find out it had been delivered to the office. They are never open before I have work and I get off later than their office hours, and they are hardly ever open Saturdays. I was reminded of my package after they sent it away.
You fight for parking spaces close to where you live or you pay $60 for a reserved parking spot. Its not laid out very well.
There are some sketchy characters that hang around there, Not necessarily residents, but homeless or people who come from the trail,  My sister had stayed the night with me and her tires were tampered with that very night.
The only plus to this place is it had a pool for the summer and close to Barkley and that is about it.
Point being there are nicer places that are better managed for cheaper.

google_reviews.author: Lynn RUTHLESS ANGEL
google_reviews.review:
Recently a tenant died unexpectedly from cancer. He and his wife were on a 6 month lease.  But due to his death she needs to move,  thereby breaking the lease.

Barkley Trails Apartments have told her she needs to pay $3000 for breaking the lease as well as another month's rent. This is a recent widow! She has funeral expenses and medical expenses from her husband to worry about.

Her husband didn't die from cancer just to inconvenience the apartment owners. This was an unexpected death as his cancer was in remission but came back unexpectedly and with a vengeance.

I would think that Barkley Trails Apartments would show a little compassion and give his widow a break rather than ripping her off like this. Tragedies happen.  Have a heart for Christ's sake.

This is taking advantage of someone who has just lost her husband,  and needs to move because she can't afford to stay with the lease. Not someone who is skipping out on the rent, or has done property damage to the apartment.

google_reviews.author: Tyler Poradun
google_reviews.review: Drove down to the office within posted business hours. Apparently, there is no dedicated receptionist because the office was locked due to a meeting with no return time posted. Knocking or calling yielded no response. I waited for 45 minutes before giving up and leaving. The sad part is I have to go back. Incredibly unprofessional and a waste of my time.

ownerResponse.text: Tyler, we're sorry to hear this feedback. What you described does not reflect our customer service expectations. Our team will continue to work diligently to ensure all visitors of our community receive exemplary customer service. When you get a moment, please contact our Property Manager to discuss the situation at 360-647-2818. At that time, you can set up a specific appointment time so that this situation does not repeat.

google_reviews.author: Gavri Wolf
google_reviews.review: While the apartments seem nice - and mine did at first - you don't notice a lot of the bad things until you live there for a while. BE AWARE THAT THEY ALLOW BOTH SMOKING AND PETS. This means someone will be smoking outside your bedroom window at all hours of the night, or you'll hear dogs barking at all hours of the night, or both. Try enjoying a nice summer breeze with your balcony door open, just to have the aroma of cigarettes come wafting in because your neighbor needs to puff puff puff. Gross. Also, the noise level is high. The washer/dryer and dishwasher are very noisy and you can clearly hear people walking/talking/etc. in the other units adjacent to yours. The grounds are not kept up very well at all times, and there are a lot of college students here. The office staff is nice but generally ineffective. For the money they charge in rent and deposits, it's not that nice of a place. Do yourself a favor and keep looking.

ownerResponse.text: Gavri,  since 2016 a lot has changed. We look for ways of bettering the community and have been successful at taking feedback and implementing guidelines for all Resident and guest enjoyment. We do have a policy of smoking at least 25' from the building (Washington law). We would hope all of our valued Residents and guests abide by them,  if not, let us know and we will respond accordingly. -Barkley Trails Team

google_reviews.author: Sean Jerns
google_reviews.review: This company will steal your money. They will take application money, and deny you without stated reason. They will provide you with a credit check that does not offer a score and not explain any reason for denial. They stole 120 dollars from us on March 22 2017. Sketchy! Beware!!

ownerResponse.text: Hi Sean, we wanted to clarify, our process for applications is the same as all screening companies. There is a fee to run the application for each person. There is a pass or fail outcome, or sometimes a conditional approval. The screening company will reply with information regarding the screening. If you input an email, it would go there and hopefully not a spam folder. There is also an option to call them directly. We don't have access to see scores etc. It seems there may have been some miscommunication about the process. We apologize for that and hope this helps when filling out future applications. -Barkley Trails Team

google_reviews.author: David Serrano
google_reviews.review: The inside and outside of the apartments are nice. Location is awesome. Office and maintenance staff is friendly and very helpful. All in all we have enjoyed our stay here.

google_reviews.author: Jade Woods
google_reviews.review: After my wife and I paid the application fee, completed the application, and they ran our background and credit check. They asked us to send them a selfie holding our ID's after this was all completed. I was told this was to verify our identity, but they had already ran a credit check. When I questioned this practice, the manager stated "we already have your information, and your social security number" and questioned why they were receiving push back. If the reasoning was truly to verify identity, they would have waited to run a credit check on someone they are claiming was not verified. We were approved pending us sending them a selfie holding our ID's. Ultimately I cancelled the application, and will be avoiding this companies properties.
